intro: Cissampelos glabra, commonly known as the smooth cissampelos, is a climbing perennial vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
